alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 12 at 6:10AM AKDT until October 13 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...High surf and coastal erosion expected. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Through 4 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Significant coastal erosion is expected due to waves. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels 2 to 3 feet above the normal high tide are expected. West winds of 25 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph will blow waves onshore causing high surf and significant erosion. The worst conditions are expected to be this morning into this afternoon. Water levels should fall and waves should decrease tonight as winds decrease.
info.instruction: Precautions should be taken to protect property. Residents should pull possessions well off the beach.
